newsitem.title: USA: CBOT soy seen flat to two cents down on exports.
newsitem.headline: CBOT soy seen flat to two cents down on exports.

text.p: CBOT soybean futures were called to open steady to two cents lower on mediocre export sales, CBOT traders said.
"The bean sales are on the low end," said a trader.
USDA put net weekly export sales at 238,900 tonnes, which was at the low end of expectations for 200,000 to 400,000 tonnes.
Some traders said that expected gains in soymeal futures could push soybean prices up a bit, however.

A report from the USDA attache in Argentina that cuts the size of that nation's soybean crop could be supportive. The attache said dry weather had sliced the Argentine soybean crop to 12.5 million tonnes from a previous estimate of 13.25.
